name: Falcon 9
description: A reusable, two-stage rocket designed for reliable and safe transport of satellites, cargo, and humans to orbit. Falcon 9 is the first orbital-class rocket capable of reflight.

name: Falcon Heavy
description: The world’s most powerful operational rocket, capable of carrying large payloads into orbit and beyond, with three Falcon 9 boosters working in tandem.

name: Starship
description: A fully reusable next-generation spacecraft designed for deep space missions, including Mars colonization. Starship aims to carry large cargo loads and passengers.

name: Dragon Capsule
description: A spacecraft designed to transport cargo and crew to the International Space Station (ISS) and beyond. It features life-support systems and reusability.

name: Starlink
description: A satellite internet service providing high-speed, low-latency broadband globally, especially in remote and underserved areas.

name: Raptor Engine
description: A highly efficient full-flow staged combustion engine that powers Starship and Super Heavy booster, using liquid methane and liquid oxygen as propellants.

name: Super Heavy Booster
description: A massive rocket booster designed to lift Starship into orbit. It is fully reusable and features multiple Raptor engines for maximum thrust.

name: Polaris Program
description: A series of private crewed missions designed to test new spaceflight technologies, including the first commercial spacewalk using SpaceX's advanced spacecraft.

name: Lunar Starship
description: A variant of the Starship spacecraft designed to land astronauts on the Moon under NASA’s Artemis program, featuring enhanced landing capabilities.

name: SpaceX Rideshare Program
description: A cost-effective way for small satellite companies to launch their payloads by sharing a ride on Falcon 9 missions, reducing overall costs.
